# CBXShell Docs (LLM index - full)

CBXShell is a modern Windows shell extension (thumbnail handler) written in Rust.
It renders thumbnails for comic book archives and common archives that contain images.

Quick facts
- Platforms: Windows 10/11
- Archives: .cbz/.cbr/.cb7, ZIP, RAR, 7z
- Images: JPEG/PNG/GIF/BMP/TIFF/ICO + WebP + AVIF
- Windows APIs: IThumbnailProvider, IInitializeWithStream
- Includes a configuration manager GUI

Docs (English)
- Overview: https://clickin.github.io/CBXShell-rs/overview/
- Installation: https://clickin.github.io/CBXShell-rs/installation/

- Configuration Manager: https://clickin.github.io/CBXShell-rs/manager/
- Logging: https://clickin.github.io/CBXShell-rs/logging/
- Architecture: https://clickin.github.io/CBXShell-rs/architecture/
- Packaging: https://clickin.github.io/CBXShell-rs/packaging/
- Project Structure: https://clickin.github.io/CBXShell-rs/structure/
- FAQ & Troubleshooting: https://clickin.github.io/CBXShell-rs/faq/

Official links
- GitHub repo: https://github.com/Clickin/CBXShell-rs
- Releases: https://github.com/Clickin/CBXShell-rs/releases

FAQ topics
- Explorer thumbnails not appearing
- Archive entries with unsupported image formats
- WebP/AVIF decode failures or performance
